author: peter.davies
content: `store_code` does two things: calculates the code hash and stores the code in the DB so that `get_code` can turn a code hash back into code later.

author: peter.davies
content: I'm going to call them `hash_and_store_code` and `code_from_hash` so that it is clearer.

author: samwilsn
content: Ah, I see. So if you store two different code buffers, they'll be at different locations. Dunno how I missed that ðŸ˜›

author: samwilsn
content: I strongly prefer `store_code` over `hash_and_store_code`, at least in Rust.
